result.execSummary:
The defendant Roosevelt Montague IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Select a counseling or support program and participate.  Pay balance of ZCI fees during term of probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Huber for employment.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Roosevelt Montague in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Def req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied until proof of employment is provided.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 3/4/2016** Co signature bond with grandmother Margie Stewart, DOB: 5-01-1938. Must reside at 2203 16th Street Racine, WI. Curfew will be7pm, grandmother must approve all friends, must get permission from her to leave the house and is not allowed friends over unless approved by the grandmother. No drugs with ZCI to monitor.

**AMENDED 3-22-2016:  To allow defendant to attend work at KMart past 7:00 pm curfew.**
